Articles.Content:
**Science - Full reward!** **** **Now finally up and running in 1.7.3!** **Ground experiments from Making History are excluded and will function normally again!**

**What it does:**

- Some experiments require you to do them multiple times at the same location to max out your science gain.
- If you, like me, don't want to do it this way this mod is for you. It just makes you get the 100% science-reward the first time you do the experiment.

***But only if you recover it**. This mod does **not** get rid of the penalty for transmitting data, **it only affects the execution of an experiment.***

**Here is what it does "in action"; Fresh game, first time on the launchpad, full green bar:**![xN7DxzK.png](http://i.imgur.com/xN7DxzK.png)  

Needs: **[Modulemanager](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/50533-131-module-manager-304-feb-11th-2018-early-christmas-gift/)**

Download/Source:  
**[Download](http://spacedock.info/mod/74/Science%20-%20Full%20reward!)** from Spacedock

[Source](https://github.com/maculator/Science-Full-reward) on Github

*Thanks to [@Malah](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/96644-malah/) and the guys from the <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr> IRC it is now in the repository, thanks alot.*

**Edited <time datetime="2019-09-28T07:56:30Z" title="09/28/2019 07:56  AM" data-short="4 yr">September 28, 2019</time> by maculator**
  
Updated for 1.7.3
Great idea!

Awesome! This is going straight onto the recommended mod list for [Field Research](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/123892). ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Should've named this "One and Done" ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

It's not actually working for the Materials Bay. I'll take a look at the MM config.

[![screenshot107_zpstp5dznof.png](http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v214/smjjames/screenshot107_zpstp5dznof.png)](http://smg.photobucket.com/user/smjjames/media/screenshot107_zpstp5dznof.png.html)

Oh I must admit, since it took a while to figure out how it works I didnt test everything... sorry ill have a look when im home

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-18T19:00:42Z" title="06/18/2015 07:00  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 18, 2015</time> by maculator**
This looks awesome! I'm mostly through the tech tree already, but I'll keep this one in mind for my next save.

Alright, I found the mistake. Im sorry but i have literally no experience in anything related to modding.

Just a little trivia: It took me 3h to throw those ~50 word of coding together. i looked into other MM configs and did it the bruteforce style. But since it is so small there shouldnt be much space for further faults.

By the way i got a number wrong that was all...

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-18T20:02:15Z" title="06/18/2015 08:02  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 18, 2015</time> by maculator**
  
googled "synonym for mistake"

Good idea. In theory the idea of being able to do experiments multiple times in a single biome makes sense, until you realize that many people will want 100% of the science or else feel like they left stuff behind. This is a great way of making sure that doesn't happen.

Awesome! Thanks, love it. Always kind of bugged me...

In terms of your questions, does [this post](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55219-Module-Manager-2-3-5-%28Sept-14%29-Loading-Speed-Fix?p=1416253&viewfull=1#post1416253) help? I'm not an MM expert but I believe the # notation, something like

    %baseValue = #$scienceCap$

might be what you're after.

Glad to be of service!
Would you get togeather with CKAN for this?

> 
> Would you get togeather with CKAN for this?

I thought ticking the "publish on ckan" on kerbalstuff would do. They might need a day or two. gotta be patient, I put this up a few houers ago.
Nothing urget. But just keep that option in mind.
So its not done by ticking the ckan on kerbalstuff. But I managed to put it on right now yo just sit back and wait for it to show up!

AZAB I just put the ZIP together, because I too had this idea when I changed to variables.

Now its going to be the smallest plugin ever...

Hoi:)

This is still not on CKAN btw. At least i cant find it. Sorry to be a ..... about it.

Everything is done. Its on its way to the index, just a few houers and it should show.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-21T16:17:59Z" title="06/21/2015 04:17  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 21, 2015</time> by maculator**
Nice little mod ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) showing on ckan now as well.
So this also works on 1.0.3 ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

What a good idea. It also bugged me that you sometimes have to make multiple trips for the same info. 

I suspect I know the answer to this question, but I shall ask anyway: Does this mod work retroactively for experiments I have run, or will it only affect new ones?

> I suspect I know the answer to this question, but I shall ask anyway: Does this mod work retroactively for experiments I have run, or will it only affect new ones?

I suspect that you suspectet correct in the first place ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif) it only changes the general values while doing an experiment. Whats done is not affected
I always wondered why did SQUAD do that to expreiments in first place? Before crew members got their roles it worked just like in this mod.
